description: An island in the Calm Belt inhabited solely by the Kuja tribe, a warrior tribe of women. Also known as the Island of Women. Ruled by Boa Hancock as the Snake Princess.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Decides to Leave
keyEvents.description: Luffy expresses his determination to leave Amazon Lily and reunite with his crew.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up Luffy's departure from the island and his journey to save Ace.

keyEvents.title: Marguerite Attacks Luffy
keyEvents.description: Marguerite attacks Luffy with haki-infused arrows, forcing him to flee into the jungle.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the consequences of Amazon Lily's strict laws against men.

statusHistory.description: Amazon Lily remains under Kuja control

politicalStatus.worldGovernmentAffiliation: Protected by treaty due to Hancock's Warlord status

trivia: Amazon Lily is located in the Calm Belt, making it difficult to reach without special means
Men are forbidden on the island, and Luffy is an unprecedented exception
The island's isolation has preserved the Kuja's unique warrior culture

description: A Marine battleship commanded by Vice-Admiral Momonga, sent to Amazon Lily to summon Boa Hancock to the upcoming war against Whitebeard.

keyEvents.title: Hancock Meets Momonga
keyEvents.description: Boa Hancock boards Momonga's ship to hear his message from the World Government.
keyEvents.significance: Location where Hancock is formally summoned to the war and where she demonstrates her powers.

keyEvents.title: Ace's Execution Announced
keyEvents.description: Momonga informs Hancock of Ace's scheduled execution on this ship.
keyEvents.significance: Critical plot point that sets up the Summit War saga.

keyEvents.title: Crew Petrified by Hancock
keyEvents.description: Hancock uses Mero Mero Mellow to turn Momonga's entire crew into stone statues on the ship.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Hancock's power and the devastating effectiveness of her Devil Fruit.

statusHistory.description: Marine ship remains operational despite crew being petrified

trivia: This ship was able to reach Amazon Lily in the Calm Belt, likely using special Marine technology
Most of the crew was turned to stone by Hancock's powers, leaving only Momonga conscious
